page.description: The definition of a bar point.

discussion.p: The bar point will draw a data point on the chart as an area. This requires that one axis be "discrete" and the other be "continuous". The bar creates a filled area representing the data point as the area on the "continuous" axis between the "base" and "value".

If the "stagger" property is set to "false", then the bars will all be at the same location on the "discrete" axis of the chart (this is useful when showing stacked values). Otherwise the bars will be spaced along the "discrete" axis so as not to be overlapping.
If a "size" is specified, then the size of the bar on the "discrete" axis will be the size passed in. Otherwise the size will be automatically calculated taking the "margin" into account.
The "margin" defines the space between bars, with "major" being the distance between bars of different "discrete" values, and "minor" being the distance between bars of the same "discrete" value.
The "label" settings applicable to the bar are "location" and "callout.from".

Values of "label.location" can be "none", "callout", "outside" and "inside". A value of "inside" will draw the label in the middle of the bar area. A value of "outside" will draw the label outside of the bar area.

Values of "callout.from" can be "center", "start" and "end". By default the callout line will be drawn relative to the outside of the area. An optional prefix of "middle" or "inner" can be used to place the line either in the "middle" or "inner" edge of the area. For example "middle center" will draw the line to the exact center of the area, while "center" will draw the line to the outside center of the area.

property.name: stagger
property.description: If false, then the bars will not be staggered. A value of true will stagger the bars. String value can be "asc" (order bars low to high value), "desc" (order bars high to low value), "exclude-nulls" (do not show null bars), "exclude-nulls-asc" and "exclude-nulls-desc". A function called with "data" (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*) and "temp" can be used to dynamically calculate the stagger.

property.name: size
property.description: The size of the bar along the axis alternate to the value. For example on a rectangular chart with the value showing on the "y" axis, this would be the width (e.g. "x" axis) of the bar. A value of "auto" (the default) will size the bars to fill the space after taking margins into account. If a number is given then the axis alternate to the value of the bar will be the size specified.

property.name: major
property.description: The major margin defines the space between groups of bars.

property.name: minor
property.description: The minor margin defines the space between bars inside of a group.

property.name: line
property.description: The bar line definition. See *[link:A5.chart Definition Line Object]*.

property.name: fill
property.description: The bar fill definition. See *[link:A5.chart Definition Fill Object]*.

property.name: label
property.description: The bar label. See *[link:A5.chart Definition Label Object]*.

property.name: attrs
property.description: The attributes to add to the bar element. A function called with "data" (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*) and "temp" can be used to dynamically calculate the attributes.

property.name: tip
property.description: The mouseover tip to add to the bar element. A function called with "data" (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*) and "temp" can be used to dynamically calculate the tip.
